  • 构造器详细资料

    • TwoDimPolygon

      public TwoDimPolygon(double[][] vertices)
      Constructs a two-dimensional polygon from the given vertices.
      参数:
      vertices - the vertices of the polygon

    • TwoDimPolygon

      public TwoDimPolygon()
      Constructs a two-dimensional polygon with no vertices. This constructor is intended to be used for testing or when the vertices of the polygon are not known at construction time.

  • 方法详细资料

    • getArea

      public double getArea()
      Returns the area of the polygon.
      返回:
      the area of the polygon

    • setVertices

      public void setVertices(double[][] vertices)
      Sets the vertices of the polygon and recalculates its area.

      The vertices must form a valid polygon. If the vertices are invalid, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

      覆盖:
      setVertices 在类中 Polygon
      参数:
      vertices - the new vertices to set
      抛出:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the vertices do not form a valid polygon

    • caculateMeasure

      protected double caculateMeasure()
      Calculates the measure of the polygon.

      This method simply calls the calculateArea method, which is an abstract method that must be implemented by subclasses.

      指定者:
      caculateMeasure 在类中 Polygon
      返回:
      the measure of the polygon

    • calculateArea

      protected abstract double calculateArea()

    • isRightVertices

      public boolean isRightVertices(double[][] vertices)
      Checks if the given vertices are valid for a two-dimensional polygon.

      A valid polygon must satisfy the following conditions: 1. The number of vertices must be greater than or equal to 3 2. The vertices must not be duplicate 3. The edges must not intersect

      指定者:
      isRightVertices 在类中 Polygon
      参数:
      vertices - the vertices to check
      返回:
      true if the vertices are valid, false otherwise

    • hasDuplicateVertices

      protected static boolean hasDuplicateVertices(double[][] vertices)
      Checks if the given vertices contain any duplicate points.
      参数:
      vertices - the vertices to check
      返回:
      true if any two points are the same, false otherwise

    • hasIntersectingEdges

      protected static boolean hasIntersectingEdges(double[][] vertices)
      Checks if the polygon defined by the given vertices has any intersecting edges.

      This method iterates over each pair of non-adjacent edges in the polygon and checks if they intersect. An edge is defined by two consecutive vertices, and non-adjacent edges are those that do not share a common endpoint.

      参数:
      vertices - the vertices defining the polygon
      返回:
      true if any non-adjacent edges intersect, false otherwise

    • areIntersecting

      protected static boolean areIntersecting(double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2, double x3, double y3, double x4, double y4)
      Checks if the given line segments are intersecting.

      The given line segments are defined by the points (x1, y1), (x2, y2), (x3, y3), and (x4, y4). The line segments are intersecting if the line segments have a common point that is not one of the end points of the line segments.

      参数:
      x1 - the x-coordinate of the first end point of the first line segment
      y1 - the y-coordinate of the first end point of the first line segment
      x2 - the x-coordinate of the second end point of the first line segment
      y2 - the y-coordinate of the second end point of the first line segment
      x3 - the x-coordinate of the first end point of the second line segment
      y3 - the y-coordinate of the first end point of the second line segment
      x4 - the x-coordinate of the second end point of the second line segment
      y4 - the y-coordinate of the second end point of the second line segment
      返回:
      true if the line segments are intersecting, false otherwise

    • direction

      protected static double direction(double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2, double x3, double y3)
      Calculates the direction of the turn formed by three points.

      This method uses the cross product to determine the relative orientation of the triplet (x1, y1), (x2, y2), (x3, y3). The result is positive if the orientation is counterclockwise, negative if clockwise, and zero if the points are collinear.

      参数:
      x1 - x-coordinate of the first point
      y1 - y-coordinate of the first point
      x2 - x-coordinate of the second point
      y2 - y-coordinate of the second point
      x3 - x-coordinate of the third point
      y3 - y-coordinate of the third point
      返回:
      a positive value if the orientation is counterclockwise, negative if clockwise, and zero if collinear

    • onSegment

      protected static boolean onSegment(double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2, double x3, double y3)
      Checks if the point (x3,y3) is on the line segment with endpoints (x1,y1) and (x2,y2).
      参数:
      x1 - x-coordinate of the first endpoint
      y1 - y-coordinate of the first endpoint
      x2 - x-coordinate of the second endpoint
      y2 - y-coordinate of the second endpoint
      x3 - x-coordinate of the point to check
      y3 - y-coordinate of the point to check
      返回:
      true if the point is on the line segment, false otherwise
